{{also|jähr}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|jār}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*jērą}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*yōr-}}, from {{m|ine-pro|*yeh₁r-}}. Compare {{cog|nl|jaar}}, {{cog|en|year}}, {{cog|da|år}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/jaː(ɐ̯)/|[jaːɐ̯]|[jaː]}} * {{audio|de|De-Jahr.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|aːɐ̯|aː}} * {{homophones|de|ja}} {{qualifier|not official standard}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n|Jahres|gen2=Jahrs|Jahre|pl2=Jahr|Jährchen}} # [[year]] {{gloss|solar year, the time it takes the Earth to complete one revolution of the Sun}} # year {{gloss|time it takes for any astronomical object to directly orbit its star}} # year {{gloss|period between set dates that mark a year}} # year {{gloss|level or grade in school or college}} ====Usage notes==== * The normal plural is '''Jahre'''. * The unchanged plural ''Jahr'' is rare in formal prose, but may be found in colloquial or poetic language. It is used chiefly after numerals, most often in adverbial constructions such as ''zwei '''Jahr''' später'' (“two '''years''' later”). * In colloquial German, a double plural {{m|de|Jahrende}} may be heard in the sense of “ages”, “a very long time”. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|es|e}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de |bejahrt |diesjährig |jahrelang |-jährig |jährlich }} ====Related terms==== {{rel3|de |Halbjahr |Lichtjahr |Neujahr |Vierteljahr |Vorjahr |Weinjahr |Jahresanfang|Jahresabonnement|Jahresabschluss |Jahresbeitrag |Jahresende |Jahreskarte |Jahresrückblick |Jahrestag |Jahresurlaub |Jahresviertel |Jahreswechsel |Jahreszahl|Jahreszeit |Jahrgang |Jahrhundert |Jahrmarkt |Jahrtausend |Jahrzehnt }} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|eo|jaro}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Time]] [[Category:de:Units of measure]]
